cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the southeast and central Gulf of Mexico, then bending north-northwest toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (roughly between Morgan City and New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Texas – Hurricane Watch begins east of Cameron, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Sabine Pass eastward across Louisiana to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but not certain (most guidance 2–4 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (NHC surge watch indicates 2–4 ft possible)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Sun night–Mon as outer bands reach southeast Texas
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft inundation in Sabine Lake/Port Arthur area under Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Sunday night through Monday could total 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas along approaches to the Sabine-Neches ship channel
